intro: Thalictrum vegetum, commonly known as the common meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Thalictrum vegetum is often found in woodlands, meadows, and stream banks, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
